image.altText: View directly up at two power poles in Queensland. Stretton Recreation Reserve.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is relying on gas as the key to bringing down local power prices, but energy analysts say it's risky to put all the eggs in the gas basket.

title.children: Analysts warn reliance on Beetaloo gas over renewables a risky strategy

image.altText: Collage of images from the live export ban in 2011

props.synopsis: Furious cattle producers are heading back to court to win compensation that hundreds of claimants have still not received since a successful class action against the Commonwealth's 2011 live export ban to Indonesia.

title.children: Cattle industry set for 'all guns blazing' live export ban compo fight

image.altText: NT parliament building

props.synopsis: Over six sitting days, six pieces of legislation were introduced and five bills were passed through the Northern Territory's only parliamentary chamber.

title.children: Five bills passed NT parliament in six days. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A sign that reads Parliament House on the right, with the NT parliament house behind and an Aboriginal flag displayed.

props.synopsis: The NT's sacred sites authority says the "rapid timeframe" and "limited nature" of proposed amendments to the NT Sacred Sites Act "raises many questions about why this is happening".

title.children: Warning 'rushed' changes to NT sacred site laws risk 'unintended consequences'

image.altText: NT Deputy Chief Minister Gerard Maley, standing under a large tree and looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's renewables minister says the government is scrapping a target of 50 per cent renewable energy by 2030, labelling it an "unrealistic and failed policy".

title.children: NT government scraps territory's 50 per cent renewables target

image.altText: The open mouth of a crocodile emerges from an egg.

props.synopsis: Selling crocodile eggs is an important business for remote Indigenous rangers who brave Top End swamps to collect them for farms. But this harvest has yielded fewer viable embryos than usual.

title.children: Croc eggs 'cooked' in sun as rain comes late in nesting season

image.altText: Peter Dutton holds a beer glass to his lips, surrounded by people in suits

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton will embark on their first full day of campaigning on Saturday, ahead of a federal election called for May 3.

title.children: Dutton sees path to minority government as both leaders declare they can win majority

image.altText: Karratha Generics, The The Karratha Gas Plant (KGP) is one of the most advanced, integrated gas production systems in the world, producing LNG, domestic gas, condensate and LPG. The facility is located 1260 kilometres north of Perth, Western Australia in the town of Karratha and covers about 200 hectares. July 28 2022. (ABC Image_Brendan Esposito) ARCHIVING  - KARRATHA GAS

props.synopsis: A leading gas expert and strident Labor critic has suggested the Coalition's policy could lead to less gas.

title.children: 'Populist' and a 'betrayal': Leading gas expert lets rip on Dutton plan

image.altText: dutton albo

props.synopsis: The election campaign begins with both sides already having given their campaign policy speeches.

title.children: At the absolutely crucial moment, something happened to both leaders

image.altText: Marlin Stutzman sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: As American producers lobby Donald Trump to put tariffs on Australian meat imports, a Republican cattle-rancher takes the fight to the US Congress.

title.children: Republican rancher introduces bill for 70pc tariff on Australian Wagyu

image.altText: Rescue workers take an injured man

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military leader has called on any country or organisation to help his country rebuild after the devastating earthquake.

title.children: Rare plea from Myanmar military after 144 people killed in earthquake

image.altText: Two white men in suits on a tan background wearing glasses

props.synopsis: The Queensland capital is home to a trio of three-cornered contests, putting the prospect of a hung parliament firmly in view.

title.children: All eyes on Brisbane as Labor, Liberal and Greens campaigns converge

image.altText: The front of a budget book with a navy cover and Australian government logo printed on it that says "Budget 2025-26".

props.synopsis: The budget papers suggest the end of deficits would be a decade away, but new analysis says even that timeframe is unrealistic.

title.children: Whoever wins the election, a $100b budget black hole awaits

image.altText: A photo of pilot Glenn Collins.

props.synopsis: The airshow is resuming on Saturday following a crash on Friday that left pilot, Glenn Collins, from Paul Bennet Airshows with critical injuries.

title.children: Pilot critical but stable after crash at Avalon International Airshow

image.altText: A man is seen as a wave splashes on the rocks.

props.synopsis: The worst of the wet weather has passed for the Gold Coast and Brisbane but the region's rivers are expected to continue to run high after hefty totals swelled catchments.

title.children: 'Rain on the way out' for Brisbane and Gold Coast after big deluge

image.altText: Children wade through floodwater on a road

props.synopsis: Communities in Western Australia's north are on high alert for the risk of flooding as ex-Tropical Cyclone Dianne continues to move inland after crossing the coast on Saturday morning.

title.children: 'You can almost surf on it': Locals welcome deluge from cyclone in WA's north

image.altText: A river flooding, with rain clouds forming above the sky

props.synopsis: Much of Australia is being drenched by rain or thunderstorms this weekend thanks to a rare southern intrusion of very moist equatorial air.

title.children: Weekend washout as Queensland deluge reaches NSW

image.altText: Man speaking into a microphone behind a podium with people in military clothing standing behind him.

props.synopsis: US Vice-President JD Vance accused Denmark of failing to protect Greenland from the threat of Russia and China.

title.children: Vance criticises Denmark for not keeping Greenland safe

image.altText: Flames and large plumes of smoke wafting skyward on top of a house.

props.synopsis: The mass Russian drone attack also sparked a large fire late on Friday, the regional governor said.

title.children: Russian drone attack kills four as Ukraine launches surprise offensive

image.altText: a US flag is shown behind a Wall st street sign

props.synopsis: With little risk of inflation spiking higher, the RBA could comfortably move to cut interest rates on Tuesday. But it's highly unlikely to do so, and it's worth exploring why.

title.children: Will Wall Street's plunge influence the RBA's interest rates decision?

image.altText: Tayyip Erdoğan in a photo from the 90s.

props.synopsis: Nationwide protests are rocking Türkiye as its jailed presidential alternative issues a message from jail.

title.children: Why a university degree from 1994 is central to the protests rocking Türkiye

image.altText: A silhouette of a man is looking to a projected blue light.

props.synopsis: Even though the tech sector had low expectations for this budget, there's something impressive about the fact that budget week still managed to genuinely surprise and worry even the most devoted realists in the tech economy.

title.children: 'Zip. Zero. Zilch': The hole in the budget that's shocked the tech sector

image.altText: A composite image of four fair-skinned men, three of whom are in military uniform.

props.synopsis: Damning evidence, a radio shock jock, and accusations of witness intimidation have dominated hearings into a defence helicopter crash off the Queensland coast that killed four aviators.

title.children: Damning evidence aired at Taipan helicopter crash inquest

image.altText: Smiling man in a dark shirt and cap with a 'Return and Earn' logo behind him

props.synopsis: A NSW man has gone to great lengths to cash in on recycling, returning almost half a million cans over seven years to save for his first home.

title.children: Lifelong recycler saves house deposit by collecting cans and bottles

image.altText: Kate Ceberano sings into a microphone with her eyes closed and one hand raised. She has two plaits in her brown hair

props.synopsis: After another season exploring the essence of creativity with some of the nation's biggest names, I've learned they have a few things in common.

title.children: Start young, work hard: Australia's top creatives have a lot in common

image.altText: A large dark grey smoke plume billowing over tightly populated suburban buildings in Beirut

props.synopsis: The Israeli Defense Forces says it launched strikes on a Hezbollah drone storage facility in the Beirut suburb of Dahieh.

title.children: Israel strikes Beirut for first time since Hezbollah ceasefire began

image.altText: Two men in suits standing together talking

props.synopsis: In what's expected to be a close race across the country, every vote in the Federal Election will count — and a handful of Western Australian seats could decide who forms the nation's next government.

title.children: The WA seats that could decide Australia's next government

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines flight comes into land at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: In South Australia, only two marginal seats are regarded as up for grabs at this election, so the campaign jets might not be descending with anything like the same frequency as they will elsewhere, writes Kathryn Bermingham.

title.children: Two SA seats will be hotly contested in the federal election

image.altText: An indian woman in her 30s smiles at the camera in a door frame

props.synopsis: Curry is a dish that has become symbolic of Indian cuisine, but the word itself doesn't originate from India, and many Indian people bristle at its association with their culture.

title.children: Curry has become symbolic of Indian food, but its origins tell another story

image.altText: Russia's Daria Kasatkina hitting a forehand shot in a tennis match

props.synopsis: Tennis star Daria Kasatkina will represent Australia in future tournaments after her application for permanent residency was accepted by the government.

title.children: Kasatkina, world number 12, switches allegiances to represent Australia

image.altText: Driveway with wet toilet paper all over it, glimpse of grass beyond.

props.synopsis: Raw sewage is running through properties in Australia's largest northern city as infrastructure buckles after months of record-breaking rain.

title.children: Sewage running through North Queensland properties as rain continues

image.altText: Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital

props.synopsis: A man who worked at a sleep clinic at a Perth public hospital is charged with multiple offences related to footage of female patients getting undressed.

title.children: IT worker charged over intimate footage allegedly obtained from Perth hospital

image.altText: A boy with spiky black hair in a white singlet jumps in the air aiming a basketball at a hoop as players gather around him.

props.synopsis: The number of aspiring Australians being awarded sporting scholarships to American colleges is rising each year, with one Melbourne-based program breaking its own record.

title.children: Expat lands record number of US scholarships for Aussie basketballers

image.altText: She stands in a green jumper, surrounded by green plants in a garden

props.synopsis: Sue Starr has requested access to Voluntary Assisted Dying should she one day be diagnosed with dementia. But fulfilling that request would currently be illegal.

title.children: If Sue got dementia, she 'would rather go quickly' but VAD isn't an option
